linear adjective
(LINES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
consisting of relating to lines or length: Linear features, such as walls and roads, are easy to see from the air because they cut across natural features. Linear measurements may be given either in imperial or metric units, but area is normally quoted in square metres. a linear diagram

linear adjective
(MATHEMATICS & SCIENCE)
science
  specialized involving a situation in which one thing changes at the same rate as another, so that the relationship between them does not change: The throughput remains constant and the latency shows a linear increase.
mathematics
  specialized A linear equation (= mathematical statement) describes a situation in which one thing changes at the same rate as another, so that the relationship between them does not change. Linear equations have the form of straight lines, rather than curves, on a graph: These equations form a straight line graph so they are called linear equations.

media

linear adjective
(REASONABLE)
(esp. of stories or ideas) continuing in a clear and reasonable way from one part to the next: The book offers excitement, linear plot development, and dramatic descriptions.
linear adjective
(LONG MARK)
[ not gradable ] consisting of or related to straight lines: The garden has very linear paths.
